The invention of computers is credited to a number of individuals, including Charles Babbage, Alan Turing, John von Neumann, and Konrad Zuse. The invention of video games is credited to Ralph Baer, who created a prototype of a video game system in 1967. The invention of electronics is credited to Thomas Edison, who invented the first practical incandescent light bulb in 1879.

Various inventors have contributed to the development of computers, video games, and electronics. Examples include Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak (Apple computers), Nolan Bushnell (Atari video games), and Alexander Graham Bell (telephone).
